name: mattress production, pocket spring | mattress | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19826/documentation

This dataset represents the the production of one pocket spring mattress, with a dimension of  1 m width and 2 m length.The life cycle inventory data was retrieved from Lanoe, Simões and Simões (2013). The considered lifespan of the mattresses was considered to be 10 years. It was considered that a person of maximum weight 120 kg would sleep 8h/day on the mattress, resulting in 29.200 h of sleep. ;This dataset is modelled as an infrastructure, meaning that the reference product is not assigned a mass, but it has the properties of “lifetime” and “lifetime capacity”. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials.

The activity starts at the reception of the raw material at the factory. The activity includes the manufacturing of the springs, assembling of the mattress.

The activity ends with the production of one unit of polyurethane foam mattress. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/31:Manufacture of furniture/310:Manufacture of furniture/3100:Manufacture of furniture

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The start date considered the year when the paper was received by the journal (September 2012) (Lanoe, Simões and Simões, 2013). The data is considered to be still valid for the year of 2017.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: "The data is extracted from a single source. The source refers to the production of matresses in a industry located in Portugal"
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: "The data is extracted from a single source. The source refers to the production of matresses in a industry located in Portugal"
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: "The data is extracted from a single source. The source refers to the production of matresses in a industry located in Portugal"
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: "Secondary literature research. Source: Lanoë, Simões and Simoões (2013). Improving the environmental performance of bedding products by using life cycle assessment at the design stage. Journal of Cleaner Production 52 (2013) 155-164"

flow.name: mattress
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/31:Manufacture of furniture/310:Manufacture of furniture/3100:Manufacture of furniture

exchanges.description:
Literature value. The value derived from the amount for non woven fabric material described by Lanoe et al. 2013 that is 0,1674 kg. The proxy with polypropelene was based on the description of Glew et al., 2012.  How do end of life scenarios influence the environmental impact of product
supply chains? comparing biomaterial and petrochemical products Journal of Cleaner Production 29-30 (2012) 122e131.

exchanges.description: Estimated value. This infrastructure is taken as a proxy. According to the technology comment of the dataset "Plastic processing factory construction, GLO " accessed 20180111: " The life time of the tanks was assumed to be 50 years. The production machines have an assumed life time of 25 years. The yearly production is 27000 t/a”. Thus, the life time estimated output is 27000*50= 1350000 tons. As the pocket spring mattress calculated wet mass is 20,128 kg, the number of mattresses produced is 1350000 t*(1000 kg/t)/20,128 kg = 67070747 units. So, the calculation of the infrastructure is 1/lifetime capacity = 1/67070747 units.
